flashcards.english: Mũhũri wa mbica (photographer - lit. hitter of pictures), Mũgĩmwĩa (hunter), Mũrĩithia wa mahĩũ (herder of domestic animals), Mũtũri (iron monger/blacksmith), Mũũmbi wa nyũngũ (potter - lit. molder of pots), Mũgo (medicine person/traditional healer), Bundi (handyman/carpenter), Mũrĩmĩ (farmer), Ndereba (driver), Mũtongoria (leader), Borithi (police), Mũbĩa (priest - Catholic)
flashcards.notes: Extended professions list with associated verbs. Work phrases use pattern: Arutaga wĩra wa + infinitive. Examples: kũhũra mbica (to take pictures), kũgĩmwĩa nyama (to hunt animals), kũrĩithia mahĩũ (to herd animals), gũtũra mbũri (to forge iron), kũũmba nyũngũ (to mold pots), kũragũra andũ (to treat people), gũtongoria andũ (to lead people), kũnyita andũ (to arrest people)

flashcards.english: Mũrango (door), Kabati (cupboard/cabinet), Metha (table), Ndĩrica (window), Gĩtĩ (seat/chair), Gaturwa/Njĩngwa (stool)
flashcards.notes: Essential household furniture vocabulary for sitting room. Two alternative words for stool: Gaturwa and Njĩngwa

flashcards.english: Verbs: Ũka (come), Andĩka (write), Rĩra (cry), Theka (laugh), Rĩa (eat), Aria (speak), Thĩĩ (go), Thooma (read), Kira (keep quiet), Ruga (cook), Ruta wĩra (do work), Ruta (remove). Nouns: Haha (here), Irio (food), Wĩra (work), Mũirĩtu (girl), Mwanake (young man), Mũtumia (woman), Mũthũuri (man), Maĩ (water), Marũa (letter), Ũcũrũ (porridge)
flashcards.notes: Foundation week 1:2 vocabulary combining basic verbs and nouns for sentence construction. Sample sentences: Ũka haha (come here), Rĩa irio (eat food), Thĩĩ wĩra (go to work), Andĩka marũa (write a letter), Ruga ũcũrũ (cook porridge)
